title: What wouldn't be a redox reaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: Any reaction that doesn't have at least one atom that increases in oxidation number during the reaction and at least one atom that decreases in oxidation number during the reaction is not a redox reaction. The atom that decreases and the atom that increases can be atoms of the same element. Examples: 2H2 + O2 --> 2H2O ( Atoms of elements have an oxidation number of 0, so that the hydrogen atoms change from 0 to +1, which is oxidation, while the oxygen atoms change from 0 to -2, which is reduction. So the reaction is a redox reaction.)  An example of a reaction in which atoms of the same element undergo both oxidation and reduction is: 2 MnO4- (aq) + 5 Mn (s) + 16 H+ (aq) -> 7 Mn+2 (aq) + 4 H2O (l). (In this reaction, 2 manganese atoms change from +7 to +2, which is reduction, and 5 manganese atoms change from 0 to +2, which is oxidation. )  An example of a non-redox reaction is Pb(NO3)2 (aq) + Na2SO4 (aq) ---> 2 NaNO3 (aq) + PbSO (s). (No atom changes its oxidation state in this reaction.)

Practically, any reaction which does not produce changes in Oxidation States of its corresponding reactant were all Non-Redox reaction. Examples of non-redox reaction; Neutralization reaction.Double decomposition reaction.These reaction occurs both naturally and artifialy in everyday life, but its reactant undergoes no changes in Oxidation states before and after the reaction. Thus, due to no change in Oxidation states it can be considered as Non-Redox reaction.
The reactions in which oxidation numbers remain unchanged in reactants and products. Neutralization reactions,hydrolysis reactions,precipitation reactions are non-redox reactions.

Any reaction in which oxidation numbers do not change. Reactions that are often grouped as double-displacement reactions are not redox. These include acid base reactions, and precipitation reactions. Reactions between acids and carbonates or hydrogen carbonates are not redox. None of these reactions listed involve electron transfer or partial electron transfer, and the oxidation numbers/states do not change.

Acid base reaction .or neutralization reactions are non redox reactions beacuse in this case oxidation and reduction remains unchanged. E.g NaoH+HCl---->Nacl+H20 No change in oxidation or reduction state.
All the neturalizing reaction (when acid combine with base and their is formation of salt + H2O +13.7 j energy release and this process is called neturazation reaction) are non - redox reaction.
